channel.title: Selective display of NPCs etc?
channel.description:
[quote="pplsuqbawlz, post:26, topic:299955"]Nothing, it's not like you can use opengl's model vertex's to identify models between updates and find their locations on screen to click? It's not like they encrypt what the video card is doing, AT ALL. Not like they could if they wanted? They could protect it, but that's an entirely different approach they don't do, yet. I dunno, try a developer driver for a couple of days, and just have a nice watch... You could make an auto fighter without knowing the littlest bit about jaggl, java, and all that nonsense.[/quote]
This got me interested. Does anyone know what would actually have to be done, to for example make RS only render NPCs for example?

item.title: Selective display of NPCs etc?
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“n3ss3s, post:11, topic:324240”][quote author=pplsuqbawlz link=topic=420642.msg3091906#msg3091906 date=1262963526]

Yes, I’m just trying to raise interest in people who could, although now thinking about it a problem like the ones with the Packet Bot suggestions would appear, e.g when you get something from the client, you could just get the rest of the stuff aswell…

I don’t know how long you’ve been here but you’ll soon realize the majority of this community fit inside a very tiny box they are afraid to venture from. I remember when I explained using interfaces to hijack fields to the ARGA team ages ago. People who find solutions and put it to use become legends. Everyone else, leach.
[/quote]

Hehe, I’m an SRL developer and I lurk around occasionally… about the box, after Solarwind’s KYAB died off, it took us a year or two to accept the usage of reflection, which ofcourse was affected by the fact that BenLand is maybe a bit more liked than Solarwind :rolleyes:[/quote]Shit times were shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Selective display of NPCs etc?
item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

Sneaks in one of his favorite quotes…

"Look again at that dot. That's here, that's home, that's us. On it
everyone you love, everyone you know, everyone you ever heard of, 
every human being who ever was, lived out their lives. The aggregate of our joy and suffering, thousands of confident religions, ideologies,
and economic doctrines, every hunter and forager, every hero and 
coward, every creator and destroyer of civilization, every king and 
peasant, every young couple in love, every mother and father, 
hopeful child, inventor and explorer, every teacher of morals, every corrupt politician, every "superstar," every "supreme leader," every 
saint and sinner in the history of our species lived there – on a mote of 
dust suspended in a sunbeam."
- Carl Sagan

Read full topic

item.title: Selective display of NPCs etc?
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

n3ss3s:

Yes, I’m just trying to raise interest in people who could, although now thinking about it a problem like the ones with the Packet Bot suggestions would appear, e.g when you get something from the client, you could just get the rest of the stuff aswell…

You could make an entire bot from graphics library trampolines. Minus the input of course. Identifying models from vertex is actually common practice amongst hackers; on many many games… Aimbots in CS for example… Or even bots in WoW. Think about it, what changes the least in a released game? The original content… How often do you replace the knight piece of a chess board? Never. Aesthetic updates fall to the wayside of content, engine performance, and engine extension. Use that to your advantage.

There’s enough graphics drivers out there, that you can essentially go unbanned while blatantly hijacking calls by appending a stub to the driver. The majority of “detection” that is applied to these methods is minimal, they usually just query the driver for the information… Which you hijack the query with your stub and just check the register, did the query come from the application? Yes? Return setting from array_of_game_settings else call actual driver routine.

It’s just another approach to the same end, like using packet capture drivers such as winpcap to hijack socket’s data, such as popular hacks like redvex’s man-in-the-middle on diablo 2, or roundwurm for wurmonline.

I don’t know how long you’ve been here but you’ll soon realize the majority of this community fit inside a very tiny box they are afraid to venture from. I remember when I explained using interfaces to hijack fields to the ARGA team ages ago. People who find solutions and put it to use become legends. Everyone else, leach.

Read full topic

item.title: Selective display of NPCs etc?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

umm somehow differentiate npc vertices from the massive amount of other vertices being sent to the gpu?
I’m not rly sure how they do their render operations, but if they do different ones (triangle strips in that case) for each model it would make it easier. If each npc has a distinct texture you might be able to get it to only render the batches with that texture…

Read full topic

item.title: Selective display of NPCs etc?
item.dc:creator: @n3ss3s n3ss3s
item.description:
@n3ss3s wrote:

How to Hack the Client's Canavs

Nothing, it’s not like you can use opengl’s model vertex’s to identify models between updates and find their locations on screen to click? It’s not like they encrypt what the video card is doing, AT ALL. Not like they could if they wanted? They could protect it, but that’s an entirely different approach they don’t do, yet. I dunno, try a developer driver for a couple of days, and just have a nice watch… You could make an auto fighter without knowing the littlest bit about jaggl, java, and all that nonsense.

This got me interested. Does anyone know what would actually have to be done, to for example make RS only render NPCs for example?

Read full topic
